I am committed to making sure childcare assistance keeps pace with rising costs for our military families!

I‚Äôve introduced an amendment that requires the DOD to find methods to ensure that the caps on the Child Care Fee Assistance program in the DOD are sufficient for all military families, regardless if they live in high-cost communities.

The DOD views childcare as a critical tool to improve the readiness, efficiency, and retention of its military. However, access to on-base childcare is limited and the cost of off-base care is rising.

My amendment would require the DOD to study how to increase the number of women in military STEM jobs and STEM post-service careers.

We have inspiring women working in STEM fields at Picatinny and across the country, but unfortunately, in the military and our civilian workforce, women continue to be underrepresented in occupations focused on science, tech, engineering, and math.
I have repeatedly criticized the Navy for not having a strategy, and this is a step toward improving our naval and shipbuilding strategy and strengthening our national security.

My amendment to study the future of the Navy will ensure that the world‚Äôs most formidable maritime force remains a strong deterrent capable of projecting strength and defending our nation at a moment‚Äôs notice anywhere in the world.

Great news! My amendment to the FY 2023 NDAA to establish a national commission on the future of the Navy passed. 

As a Naval Academy graduate & 20-year Navy veteran, I care deeply about the Navy and the service‚Äôs role in protecting & defending our interests at home and abroad.

That's why I was proud to introduce an amendment to increase funding for the Army to research novel armament systems and technologies -- important research that will be done right in NJ-11 at Picatinny Arsenal.

Our adversaries have been investing heavily in cutting-edge new munitions. To keep our edge, we have to ramp up our investments in our weapons technology & give our scientists and engineers the funding they need to think outside the box and challenge the status quo.

It is regrettable that the committee continues to fail to identify spending offsets to support military families and expand their health care benefits to match civilian families.

Military families currently do not have the same benefit of allowing young adults to stay on their parents‚Äô health care plan. My amendment would save military families thousands of dollars a year while bringing long-overdue parity between military and civilian families.

Today, I introduced an amendment to the FY 2023 NDAA today to expand TRICARE coverage and allow young adults to remain on their parents‚Äô policy until age 26 without additional costs, potentially saving military families thousands of dollars a year.

As the Vice Chair of the House Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on Africa, I will continue to fight to end the global food crisis and work towards a more prosperous continent.

With millions of people on the verge of famine, we need to continue to rally all world leaders to increase supplies of food and fertilizers, support basic safety nets for those without food, and fund humanitarian operations to reduce famine and hunger.

I am glad to see the United States and other countries step up to provide food insecure countries in Africa, including Somalia with the financial support to fight against famine and boost economic recovery efforts. These commitments are welcome, but much more is needed.
The United Nations has warned about the imminent ‚Äòexplosion of child deaths‚Äô due to food insecurity and malnutrition in the Horn of Africa.
The impact of this crisis has been felt most acutely in the Horn of Africa, which is facing unprecedented droughts and significant conflict and political instability.

Since April, I have been working with the Biden Administration to get financial assistance to food insecure countries in Africa following Russia‚Äôs illegal war in Ukraine that is fueling the global food crisis.
I am thrilled the Horn of Africa will receive desperately needed humanitarian aid and development assistance from USAID and IDA. (THREAD)
